definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc

sentences.english: Two different scenarios. Both started the same.
sentences.chinese: 兩個不同的情景，由同一個開首所引起。

sentences.english: At this time of the year farmers commence to plow their fields.
sentences.chinese: 每年這個光陰，農民們開首犁地。

sentences.english: At this time of the year flimisrs stfine plow their fields.
sentences.chinese: 每年這個時間，農民們開首犁地。

sentences.english: Theynove lately working on this project since last year.
sentences.chinese: 他們從去年開首不斷都在做這個項目。

sentences.english: Start the article with a short sentence, not more than 8 words.
sentences.chinese: 文章開首用短句，不要跨越8個字。

definition: to rebel against orthodoxy/to depart from established practices
writing style in which the main subject is approached directly from the outset/opposite of 冒題|冒题[mao4 ti2]
regular verse/strict poetic form with eight lines of 5, 6 or 7 syllables and even lines rhyming
start of literary work/opening song of ballad in Tanci style 彈詞|弹词[tan2 ci2]
lit. floating wine goblets on a stream/the origin (of some phenomenon)
tone/note/a tone (on a Chinese syllable)/CL:個|个[ge4]
